intro: Lepidotis alpina, commonly known as the alpine lepidotis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, adapting to cold and nutrient-poor environments. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Lepidotis alpina is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
